title: 79/303. Financing of the United Nations Peacekeeping Force in Cyprus

paragraphs.1: Requests the Secretary-General to entrust the Head of Mission with the task of formulating future budget proposals in full accordance with the provisions of its resolutions 59/296 of 22 June 2005, 60/266 of 30 June 2006, 61/276 of 29 June 2007, 64/269 of 24 June 2010, 65/289 of 30 June 2011, 66/264 of 21 June 2012, 69/307 of 25 June 2015, 70/286 of 17 June 2016 and 76/274 of 29 June 2022, as well as other relevant resolutions;
paragraphs.2: Takes note of the status of contributions to the United Nations Peacekeeping Force in Cyprus as at 30 April 2025, including the contributions outstanding in the amount of 21 million United States dollars, representing some 2.5 per cent of the total assessed contributions, notes with concern that only 81 Member States have paid their assessed contributions in full, and urges all other Member States, in particular those in arrears, to ensure payment of their outstanding assessed contributions;
paragraphs.3: Expresses its appreciation to those Member States that have paid their assessed contributions in full, and urges all other Member States to make every possible effort to ensure payment of their assessed contributions to the Force in full;
paragraphs.4: Expresses concern at the financial situation with regard to peacekeeping activities, in particular as regards the reimbursements to troop contributors that bear additional burdens owing to overdue payments by Member States of their assessments;
paragraphs.5: Emphasizes that all future and existing peacekeeping missions shall be given equal and non-discriminatory treatment in respect of financial and administrative arrangements;
paragraphs.6: Also emphasizes that all peacekeeping missions shall be provided with adequate resources for the effective and efficient discharge of their respective mandates;
paragraphs.7: Requests the Secretary-General to ensure that proposed peacekeeping budgets are based on the relevant legislative mandates;
paragraphs.8: Endorses the conclusions and recommendations contained in the report of the Advisory Committee on Administrative and Budgetary Questions, and requests the Secretary-General to ensure their full implementation;
paragraphs.9: Requests the Secretary-General to ensure the full implementation of the relevant provisions of its resolutions 59/296, 60/266, 61/276, 64/269, 65/289, 66/264, 69/307, 70/286 and 76/274;
paragraphs.10: Also requests the Secretary-General to take all action necessary to ensure that the Force is administered with a maximum of efficiency and economy; Budget performance report for the period from 1 July 2023 to 30 June 2024
paragraphs.11: Takes note of the report of the Secretary-General on the budget performance of the Force for the period from 1 July 2023 to 30 June 2024; 4 Budget estimates for the period from 1 July 2025 to 30 June 2026
paragraphs.12: Decides to appropriate to the special account for the United Nations Peacekeeping Force in Cyprus the amount of 62,762,100 dollars for the period from 1 July 2025 to 30 June 2026, inclusive of 57,319,100 dollars for the maintenance of the Force, 4,779,000 dollars for the support account for peacekeeping operations and 664,000 dollars for the United Nations Logistics Base at Brindisi, Italy; Financing of the appropriation for the period from 1 July 2025 to 30 June 2026
paragraphs.13: Notes with appreciation that a one-third share of the net appropriation, equivalent to 19,865,367 dollars, will be funded through voluntary contributions from the Government of Cyprus and the amount of 6.5 million dollars from the Government of Greece;
paragraphs.14: Decides to apportion among Member States the amount of 21,231,428 dollars for the period from 1 July 2025 to 31 January 2026, in accordance with the levels updated in its resolution 79/250 of 24 December 2024, taking into account the scale of assessments for 2025 and 2026, as set out in its resolution 79/249 of 24 December 2024;
paragraphs.15: Also decides that, in accordance with the provisions of its resolution 973 (X) of 15 December 1955, there shall be set off against the apportionment among Member States, as provided for in paragraph 14 above, their respective share in the Tax Equalization Fund of 1,846,833 dollars, comprising the estimated staff assessment income of 1,546,533 dollars approved for the Force, the prorated share of 256,142 dollars of the estimated staff assessment income approved for the support account and the prorated share of 44,158 dollars of the estimated staff assessment income approved for the United Nations Logistics Base;
paragraphs.16: Further decides to apportion among Member States the amount of 15,165,305 dollars for the period from 1 February to 30 June 2026 at a monthly rate of 3,033,061 dollars, in accordance with the levels updated in its resolution 79/250, taking into account the scale of assessments for 2026, as set out in its resolution 79/249, subject to a decision of the Security Council to extend the mandate of the Force;
paragraphs.17: Decides that, in accordance with the provisions of its resolution 973 (X), there shall be set off against the apportionment among Member States, as provided for in paragraph 16 above, their respective share in the Tax Equalization Fund of 1,319,167 dollars, comprising the estimated staff assessment income of 1,104,667 dollars approved for the Force, the prorated share of 182,958 dollars of the estimated staff assessment income approved for the support account and the prorated share of 31,542 dollars of the estimated staff assessment income approved for the United Nations Logistics Base;
paragraphs.18: Also decides that, for Member States that have fulfilled their financial obligations to the Force, there shall be set off against the apportionment, as provided for in paragraphs 14 and 16 above, their respective share of the unencumbered balance and other revenue in the amount of 756,602 dollars in respect of the financial period ended 30 June 2024, in accordance with the levels updated in its resolution 76/239 of 24 December 2021, taking into account the scale of assessments for 2024, as set out in its resolution 76/238 of 24 December 2021;
paragraphs.19: the amount of 756,602 dollars in respect of the financial period ended 30 June 2024, in accordance with the scheme set out in paragraph 18 above;
paragraphs.20: Decides that the decrease of 33,200 dollars in the estimated staff assessment income in respect of the financial period ended 30 June 2024 shall be set off against the credits in the amount of 756,602 dollars referred to in paragraphs 18 and 19 above;
paragraphs.21: Also decides, taking into account its voluntary contribution for the financial period ended 30 June 2024, that one third of the net unencumbered balance and other revenue in the amount of 454,267 dollars in respect of the financial period ended 30 June 2024 shall be returned to the Government of Cyprus;
paragraphs.22: Further decides, taking into account its voluntary contribution for the financial period ended 30 June 2024, that the prorated share of the net unencumbered balance and other revenue in the amount of 151,931 dollars in respect of the financial period ended 30 June 2024 shall be returned to the Government of Greece;
paragraphs.23: Decides to continue to maintain as separate the account established for the Force for the period prior to 16 June 1993, invites Member States to make voluntary contributions to that account, and requests the Secretary-General to continue his efforts in appealing for voluntary contributions to the account;
paragraphs.24: Encourages the Secretary-General to continue to take additional measures to ensure the safety and security of all personnel participating in the Force under the auspices of the United Nations, bearing in mind paragraphs 5 and 6 of Security Council resolution 1502 (2003) of 26 August 2003;
paragraphs.25: Invites voluntary contributions to the Force in cash and in the form of services and supplies acceptable to the Secretary-General, to be administered, as appropriate, in accordance with the procedure and practices established by the General Assembly;
paragraphs.26: Decides to include in the provisional agenda of its eightieth session the item entitled “Financing of the United Nations Peacekeeping Force in Cyprus”.
